conclusion: Initial setup of the problem with parameters and circuit description.
Induced EMF in the rod is calculated using the formula \( \mathcal{E} = B v l \).
Power consumption by \( \text{L}_1 \) is used to find its resistance \( R_1 = 3 \, \Omega \).
Total resistance in the circuit is calculated as \( R_{\text{total}} = r + R_1 + R_2 \).
Current in the circuit is calculated using Ohm's Law \( I = \frac{\mathcal{E}}{R_{\text{total}}} \).
Resistance of \( \text{L}_2 \) is calculated as \( R_2 = 6 \, \Omega \).
Actual power \( P_2 \) dissipated by \( \text{L}_2 \) is calculated as \( P_2 = 4.8 \, \text{W} \).
